intro: Heteropanax fragrans var. ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty-veined fragrant heteropanax, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and distinctive, often reddish-brown veins. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
